fields.content:
Click on the map to select the tax lot(s) that are included in your property.  Click again to unselect. At least one tax lot must be selected. Click Next (below) when you are done.

If you don't see your property here, click 'Back' and try entering another place name or address in the search bar or use your mouse to drag the map and move around if your property is nearby.

Welcome to Landmapper, a simple online tool to create maps of your property you can quickly save, download, or print. 

Landmapper is designed to help make conservation and management planning easier for forest owners.

We currently offer maps across the state, including aerial photos, street maps, topography, streams, and soil types.

Get started by locating your property.

fields.name: About
fields.content:
About Landmapper

 

We believe the path to sustainable forestry begins by assessing a property's current condition. Landowners often spend days or weeks navigating a dozen or more websites, learning new software, or visiting local offices to gather maps and tables describing their property.

Our focus with this tool is to provide a free and open-source web app that enables users across the state to click on tax lots and have relevant maps and tables for stewardship planning auto-generate and be immediately available for print or download.  

Questions? Email us at: LMinfo@ecotrust.org

fields.name: Help
fields.content:
Having trouble mapping your property?

Check out our instructional video below for a step-by-step overview of the process.  

If you still have questions, feel free to contact us:  LMinfo@ecotrust.org
